question.questionA: Stems  creeping,  rooting  at  the nodes;  leaves less than 6 mm long; flowers solitary.
question.questionB: Stems usually erect; leaves more than 6 mm long; flowers clustered.

question.questionA: Male and female flowers in the same raceme.
question.questionB: Male and female flowers in separate inflorescences.

question.questionA: Two stipules at each node; lower racemes female, upper male  and  one-sided.
question.questionB: Four  stipules  at  each node;  female  flowers with  inflated perianth  in globular heads, male flowers in erect branched clusters.

question.questionA: Perennials; bracts shorter than fruiting perianth.
question.questionB: Annuals; bracts equalling or exceeding fruiting perianth.
